vulnerabilities.summary: Critical remote code execution vulnerability in Redis allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary commands.
vulnerabilities.description: The RediShell vulnerability (CVE-2025-49844) is an out‑of‑bounds write in the Redis server that can be triggered remotely without authentication. Successful exploitation results in full remote code execution, allowing the attacker to take control of the Redis instance and pivot to other systems in the network.
affected_products: Redis (all versions prior to the emergency patch)
products_versions: Cisco devices with vulnerable SNMP implementations
Framework laptops with signed UEFI components
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the emergency security update released by Redis maintainers. Upgrade to the patched version and restart the Redis service.
workarounds: Restrict network access to Redis instances using firewall rules or security groups.
Bind Redis to localhost or a trusted internal interface.
Disable unauthenticated commands such as CONFIG and MODULE if not required.

vulnerabilities.summary: Out‑of‑bounds write in WatchGuard Fireware OS IKEv2 implementation (yIKEs) leading to unauthenticated code execution.
vulnerabilities.description: The yIKEs vulnerability (CVE-2025-9242) is an out‑of‑bounds write in the IKEv2 implementation of WatchGuard Fireware OS. An attacker can send crafted IKE packets to the VPN endpoint, triggering memory corruption and achieving unauthenticated code execution with kernel privileges.
affected_products: WatchGuard Fireware OS (specific version not disclosed)
products_versions: Cisco devices with vulnerable SNMP implementations
Framework laptops with signed UEFI components
vulnerabilities.remediation: Update to the latest WatchGuard Fireware OS release that includes the fix for CVE-2025-9242. Verify the firmware version via the WatchGuard management console.
workarounds: Temporarily disable IKEv2 VPN services if not required.
Restrict VPN access to known IP ranges using firewall ACLs.

vulnerabilities.summary: Zero‑day vulnerability in Oracle E‑Business Suite enabling remote code execution and data exfiltration.
vulnerabilities.description: Oracle released an emergency patch for CVE-2025-61884, a previously unknown flaw in the E‑Business Suite that allows an attacker with limited credentials to execute arbitrary code on the application server and extract sensitive business data. The vulnerability is actively exploited in extortion campaigns.
affected_products: Oracle E‑Business Suite (specific module not disclosed)
products_versions: Cisco devices with vulnerable SNMP implementations
Framework laptops with signed UEFI components
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the emergency patch provided by Oracle immediately. Follow Oracle's advisory to verify patch installation and restart affected services.
workarounds: Enforce multi‑factor authentication for all E‑Business Suite accounts.
Restrict access to the E‑Business Suite web interface to trusted networks.
Monitor for anomalous outbound traffic from the application server.

vulnerabilities.title: ‘Highest Ever’ Severity Score Assigned by Microsoft to ASP.NET Core Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.original_title: ‘Highest Ever’ Severity Score Assigned by Microsoft to ASP.NET Core Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: CVE-2025-55315 is an HTTP request smuggling bug leading to information leaks, file content tampering, and server crashes. The post ‘Highest Ever’ Severity Score Assigned by Microsoft to ASP.NET Core Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.
vulnerabilities.summary: HTTP request smuggling vulnerability in ASP.NET Core allowing information disclosure, file content tampering, and denial of service.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability arises from improper parsing of ambiguous HTTP request headers (e.g., Transfer-Encoding and Content-Length) in ASP.NET Core's request pipeline. An attacker can craft a malicious request that is interpreted differently by the front-end server and the ASP.NET Core application, resulting in request smuggling. This can be leveraged to read sensitive data from other users' sessions, modify file contents served by the application, or cause the application process to crash, leading to denial of service.
products_versions: ASP.NET Core versions prior to the security patch (e.g., 8.0.x before 8.0.10, 7.0.x before 7.0.15)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the Microsoft security update released for CVE-2025-55315. Upgrade ASP.NET Core to the latest patched version (e.g., 8.0.10 or later). Review and tighten request header handling configuration. Enable strict validation of Transfer-Encoding and Content-Length headers.
workarounds: Deploy a reverse proxy or web application firewall that normalizes HTTP requests before they reach ASP.NET Core.
Disable ambiguous Transfer-Encoding handling in the application configuration (e.g., set `AllowUnsafeHeaderParsing` to false).
Enforce a whitelist of allowed HTTP methods and header combinations.

vulnerabilities.title: U.S. CISA adds Adobe Experience Manager Forms flaw to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog
vulnerabilities.original_title: U.S. CISA adds Adobe Experience Manager Forms flaw to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds Adobe Experience Manager Forms flaw to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog. The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added Adobe Experience Manager Forms flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-54253 (CVSS score 10.0...
vulnerabilities.summary: Adobe Experience Manager Forms misconfiguration allowing remote arbitrary code execution without user interaction.
vulnerabilities.description: A misconfiguration in Adobe Experience Manager Forms (versions 6.5.23 and earlier) enables an attacker to bypass security controls and execute arbitrary code on the server. The flaw does not require any user interaction and can be exploited remotely over the network, leading to full system compromise. The vulnerability was added to the CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog and is assigned a CVSS v3.1 base score of 10.0.
products_versions: Adobe Experience Manager Forms 6.5.23 and earlier
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade Adobe Experience Manager Forms to the version released in August 2025 that contains the fix. Apply the official Adobe security advisory and verify that the patch is successfully installed.
workarounds: Temporarily disable the Forms component if it is not required.
Restrict network access to the AEM server to trusted IP ranges.
Ensure default configurations are hardened according to Adobe hardening guidelines.

vulnerabilities.title: CISA Flags Adobe AEM Flaw with Perfect 10.0 Score — Already Under Active Attack
vulnerabilities.original_title: CISA Flags Adobe AEM Flaw with Perfect 10.0 Score — Already Under Active Attack
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Wednesday added a critical security flaw impacting Adobe Experience Manager to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation. The vulnerability in question is CVE-2025-54253 (CVSS score:...
vulnerabilities.summary: Adobe Experience Manager misconfiguration allowing remote arbitrary code execution
vulnerabilities.description: A critical misconfiguration in Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) permits an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected server. The flaw stems from insecure default settings that expose administrative endpoints without proper access controls. Exploitation can be performed remotely over the network, leading to full system compromise.
products_versions: Adobe Experience Manager (all versions prior to the security patch released in October 2025)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the official Adobe security patch released for CVE-2025-54253. Re‑configure AEM to follow the hardening guide: disable or restrict the vulnerable endpoint, enforce authentication, and limit network exposure. Verify the patch version with Adobe Security Bulletin.
workarounds: Temporarily block inbound traffic to the vulnerable AEM endpoint at the firewall or WAF.
Disable the specific administrative servlet/service if not required.
Enforce strong authentication and restrict access to trusted IP ranges.

vulnerabilities.title: SAP fixed maximum-severity bug in NetWeaver
vulnerabilities.original_title: SAP fixed maximum-severity bug in NetWeaver
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: SAP addressed 13 new flaws, including a maximum severity vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver, which could lead to arbitrary command execution. SAP addressed 13 new vulnerabilities, including a maximum severity issue, tracked as CVE-2025-42944 (CVSS score of 10.0) in SAP NetWeaver. The vulnerability is an...
vulnerabilities.summary: Insecure deserialization in SAP NetWeaver RMI-P4 module allowing unauthenticated arbitrary OS command execution.
vulnerabilities.description: The RMI-P4 module of SAP NetWeaver accepts serialized Java objects over an open network port. An attacker can send a crafted malicious payload that, when deserialized, triggers execution of arbitrary operating system commands. This leads to full compromise of the underlying host, affecting confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the SAP security patch released for CVE-2025-42944. Disable or restrict access to the RMI-P4 service if not required. Implement network segmentation and firewall rules to block unauthenticated access to the vulnerable port.
workarounds: Block inbound traffic to the RMI-P4 port at the network perimeter.
Disable the RMI-P4 module if it is not used.

vulnerabilities.title: SAP fixed maximum-severity bug in NetWeaver
vulnerabilities.original_title: SAP fixed maximum-severity bug in NetWeaver
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: SAP addressed 13 new flaws, including a maximum severity vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver, which could lead to arbitrary command execution. SAP addressed 13 new vulnerabilities, including a maximum severity issue, tracked as CVE-2025-42944 (CVSS score of 10.0) in SAP NetWeaver. The vulnerability is an...
vulnerabilities.summary: Directory traversal in SAP Print Service (SAPSprint) enabling unauthenticated overwrite of arbitrary system files.
vulnerabilities.description: The SAP Print Service fails to properly sanitize file path inputs, allowing an attacker to use path traversal sequences (e.g., "../") to write files outside the intended directory. This can be leveraged to overwrite critical system files, leading to privilege escalation or denial of service.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Install the SAP-provided patch for CVE-2025-42937. Enforce strict input validation on file paths and restrict the service's file system permissions.
workarounds: Restrict network access to the SAP Print Service to trusted hosts only.
Run the service under a low‑privilege account with write access limited to its own directory.

vulnerabilities.title: SAP fixed maximum-severity bug in NetWeaver

vulnerabilities.content_snippet: SAP addressed 13 new flaws, including a maximum severity vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver, which could lead to arbitrary command execution. SAP addressed 13 new vulnerabilities, including a maximum severity issue, tracked as CVE-2025-42944 (CVSS score of 10.0) in SAP NetWeaver. The vulnerability is an...
vulnerabilities.summary: Unrestricted file upload in SAP Supplier Relationship Management allowing authenticated attackers to upload arbitrary files.
vulnerabilities.description: The file upload functionality in SAP Supplier Relationship Management does not verify the type or content of uploaded files. An authenticated attacker can upload executable files or scripts, which can later be downloaded and executed by other users, facilitating malware distribution or further compromise.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the SAP patch for CVE-2025-42910. Implement server‑side file type validation, content scanning, and enforce strict file‑system permissions for uploaded content.
workarounds: Limit upload functionality to trusted users only.
Configure a quarantine area for uploaded files and scan them with anti‑malware tools before use.

vulnerabilities.title: Two CVSS 10.0 Bugs in Red Lion RTUs Could Hand Hackers Full Industrial Control
vulnerabilities.original_title: Two CVSS 10.0 Bugs in Red Lion RTUs Could Hand Hackers Full Industrial Control
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed two critical security flaws impacting Red Lion Sixnet remote terminal unit (RTU) products that, if successfully exploited, could result in code execution with the highest privileges. The shortcomings, tracked as CVE-2023-40151 and CVE-2023-42770, are both rat...
vulnerabilities.summary: Critical remote code execution vulnerability in Red Lion SixTRAK and VersaTRAK RTU firmware allowing attackers to execute code with highest privileges.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability resides in the firmware of Red Lion SixTRAK and VersaTRAK remote terminal units. Exploitation allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to inject malicious code that runs with system-level privileges, potentially taking full control of the industrial control system. The exact technical root cause (e.g., buffer overflow, authentication bypass) has not been disclosed in the public article.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the vendor‑provided firmware update as soon as it is released. If a patch is not yet available, disable remote management interfaces, restrict access to trusted IP ranges, and place the devices behind a firewall or VPN.
workarounds: Block inbound traffic to the RTU management ports from untrusted networks.
Enforce network segmentation and VLAN isolation for industrial control devices.
Use strong, unique credentials for any remaining management interfaces.

vulnerabilities.title: New SAP NetWeaver Bug Lets Attackers Take Over Servers Without Login
vulnerabilities.original_title: New SAP NetWeaver Bug Lets Attackers Take Over Servers Without Login
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: SAP has rolled out security fixes for 13 new security issues, including additional hardening for a maximum-severity bug in SAP NetWeaver AS Java that could result in arbitrary command execution. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-42944, carries a CVSS score of 10.0. It has been described as a ca...
vulnerabilities.summary: Insecure deserialization in SAP NetWeaver AS Java allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands without authentication.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability stems from an insecure deserialization flaw in the SAP NetWeaver AS Java component. An attacker can send a specially crafted serialized object to a vulnerable endpoint. The server deserializes the object without proper validation, leading to execution of attacker‑controlled code. Because the flaw does not require authentication, an attacker can achieve full system compromise, including arbitrary command execution and complete takeover of the underlying operating system.
products_versions: SAP NetWeaver AS Java (all supported versions prior to the October 2025 security patch)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the SAP security patches released on 2025-10-15 that address CVE-2025-42944. Verify that the patch level for SAP NetWeaver AS Java is updated to the latest security note (SAP Security Patch Day). Additionally, review and harden deserialization handling, disable unnecessary services, and enforce strict input validation.
workarounds: Restrict network access to the vulnerable NetWeaver AS Java services to trusted IP ranges.
Deploy a Web Application Firewall (WAF) with rules to block suspicious serialized payloads.
If patching cannot be performed immediately, disable the affected deserialization functionality via SAP configuration.

vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability stems from insufficient validation of user‑supplied file paths. An attacker can craft a request that forces the application to include files outside the intended directory, leading to disclosure of sensitive configuration files, credentials, and potentially enabling further code execution.
products_versions: Vulnerable WordPress plugin (specific version not disclosed)
Juniper Junos Space (versions with nine critical flaws)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the vendor‑released patches for CentreStack and Triofox. If patches are not yet available, block external access to the vulnerable endpoints and implement strict input validation on file path parameters.
workarounds: Restrict access to the vulnerable web interfaces via firewall rules.
Deploy a web application firewall (WAF) rule to block LFI payload patterns.

vulnerabilities.summary: Privilege escalation flaw in a popular WordPress plugin that allows attackers to obtain administrator accounts.
vulnerabilities.description: The plugin fails to properly verify the authenticity of requests that modify user roles. An attacker can send a crafted request to the WordPress site, causing the plugin to promote a regular user to an administrator without proper authorization.
products_versions: Vulnerable WordPress plugin (specific version not disclosed)
Juniper Junos Space (versions with nine critical flaws)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Update the plugin to the latest version released by the developer. If no patch is available, deactivate or uninstall the plugin immediately.
workarounds: Restrict plugin usage to trusted administrators only.
Monitor WordPress logs for suspicious role‑change events.

vulnerabilities.description: A deserialization flaw in an Oracle EBS component allows an unauthenticated attacker to send a crafted HTTP request that results in arbitrary code execution on the server. The vulnerability is actively exploited in the wild by Cl0p ransomware campaigns.
products_versions: Vulnerable WordPress plugin (specific version not disclosed)
Juniper Junos Space (versions with nine critical flaws)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the Oracle security patch released for CVE‑2025‑61882. Verify that the patch is correctly installed on all EBS instances.
workarounds: Restrict inbound traffic to the EBS web tier to trusted IP ranges.
Enable Web Application Firewall (WAF) rules that block suspicious payloads.

vulnerabilities.summary: Critical remote code execution vulnerability in Fortra GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) used by the Storm‑1175 group in Medusa ransomware campaigns.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability is a deserialization issue in the GoAnywhere MFT web console that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying host. The exploit chain has been observed in the wild by the Storm‑1175 threat actor delivering Medusa ransomware.
products_versions: Vulnerable WordPress plugin (specific version not disclosed)
Juniper Junos Space (versions with nine critical flaws)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Install the security update released by Fortra for CVE‑2025‑10035. Verify that the version number matches the patched release.
workarounds: Place GoAnywhere MFT behind a reverse proxy that enforces strict request validation.
Disable the vulnerable endpoint if not required for business operations.

vulnerabilities.summary: Critical Remote Code Execution vulnerability in Redis (CVE‑2025‑49844) with a CVSS score of 10.0.
vulnerabilities.description: An unauthenticated attacker can send a specially crafted command to a Redis instance that is exposed to the internet, leading to arbitrary code execution with root privileges. The flaw is due to improper handling of module loading and command parsing.
products_versions: Vulnerable WordPress plugin (specific version not disclosed)
Juniper Junos Space (versions with nine critical flaws)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade Redis to version 7.2.5 or later where the issue is fixed. If immediate upgrade is not possible, bind Redis to localhost or restrict access via firewall.
workarounds: Configure `bind 127.0.0.1` and disable external network access.
Use `requirepass` to enforce authentication and place Redis behind a VPN.

vulnerabilities.description: Threat actors harvest leaked or reused credentials and use them to log into SonicWall SSL VPN portals, then exfiltrate configuration backups and deploy additional payloads.
products_versions: Vulnerable WordPress plugin (specific version not disclosed)
Juniper Junos Space (versions with nine critical flaws)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Enforce multi‑factor authentication (MFA) for all VPN users, rotate passwords, and monitor for anomalous login activity.
workarounds: Disable legacy authentication mechanisms.
Restrict VPN access to known IP ranges.

vulnerabilities.title: 13-Year-Old Redis Flaw Exposed: CVSS 10.0 Vulnerability Lets Attackers Run Code Remotely
vulnerabilities.original_title: 13-Year-Old Redis Flaw Exposed: CVSS 10.0 Vulnerability Lets Attackers Run Code Remotely
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Redis has disclosed details of a maximum-severity security flaw in its in-memory database software that could result in remote code execution under certain circumstances. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-49844 (aka RediShell), has been assigned a CVSS score of 10.0. "An authenticated user may ...
vulnerabilities.summary: Authenticated remote code execution via crafted Lua script that manipulates Redis garbage collector leading to use‑after‑free.
vulnerabilities.description: An authenticated Redis user can submit a specially crafted Lua script that interferes with the internal garbage collector. The manipulation triggers a use‑after‑free condition, allowing arbitrary code execution on the host running the Redis server. The flaw, dubbed RediShell, receives a CVSS v3.1 base score of 10.0 due to its remote impact and high confidentiality, integrity, and availability consequences.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade to the Redis version that includes the fix (released after CVE‑2025‑49844 disclosure). Apply the official security patch provided by Redis. If immediate upgrade is not possible, disable Lua scripting via the 'lua‑script‑disable' configuration option or restrict script execution to trusted users only.
workarounds: Disable Lua scripting (set 'lua-replication-disable' or equivalent configuration).
Enforce strong authentication and ACLs to limit script execution to trusted accounts.
Place Redis behind a firewall and restrict network access to trusted hosts.
Run Redis in a container or sandbox with limited privileges.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Links Storm-1175 to GoAnywhere Exploit Deploying Medusa Ransomware
vulnerabilities.original_title: Microsoft Links Storm-1175 to GoAnywhere Exploit Deploying Medusa Ransomware
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Microsoft on Monday attributed a threat actor it tracks as Storm-1175 to the exploitation of a critical security flaw in Fortra GoAnywhere software to facilitate the deployment of Medusa ransomware. The vulnerability is CVE-2025-10035 (CVSS score: 10.0), a critical deserialization bug that could res...
vulnerabilities.summary: Critical deserialization vulnerability in Fortra GoAnywhere MFT allowing unauthenticated command injection.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability is a deserialization bug in GoAnywhere MFT that can be triggered remotely without authentication. An attacker can craft malicious serialized objects that, when processed by the server, lead to arbitrary command execution on the underlying operating system. This flaw was leveraged by the Storm-1175 threat actor to deploy the Medusa ransomware payload.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade GoAnywhere MFT to version 7.8.4 or later, which contains the fix for CVE-2025-10035. Apply any additional patches released by Fortra.
workarounds: Restrict network access to the GoAnywhere management interface using firewalls or VPNs.
Disable or limit remote file transfer functionality until the patch is applied.
Implement Web Application Firewall (WAF) rules to block suspicious serialized payloads.

vulnerabilities.title: U.S. CISA adds Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT, Libraesva ESG, and Sudo flaws to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog
vulnerabilities.original_title: U.S. CISA adds Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT, Libraesva ESG, and Sudo flaws to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT, Libraesva ESG, and Sudo flaws to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog. The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT,...
vulnerabilities.summary: Adminer Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) allowing attackers to make arbitrary HTTP requests from the server.
vulnerabilities.description: The Adminer web interface fails to properly validate URLs supplied to certain functions, enabling an attacker to craft requests that are sent from the server to internal or external resources. This can lead to information disclosure, port scanning, or interaction with internal services.
products_versions: Cisco IOS/IOS XE (all versions with SNMP enabled)
Fortra GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.8.4 / 7.6.3 sustain release
Libraesva Email Security Gateway (versions prior to vendor patch)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade to the latest Adminer release where the SSRF issue is fixed. Apply input validation and restrict outbound connections from the server.
workarounds: Block outbound HTTP/HTTPS traffic from the Adminer host using firewall rules.
Configure a reverse proxy that validates and restricts URLs.

vulnerabilities.title: U.S. CISA adds Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT, Libraesva ESG, and Sudo flaws to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog
vulnerabilities.original_title: U.S. CISA adds Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT, Libraesva ESG, and Sudo flaws to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT, Libraesva ESG, and Sudo flaws to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog. The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT,...
vulnerabilities.summary: Stack-based buffer overflow in Cisco IOS/IOS XE SNMP subsystem leading to DoS or remote code execution.
vulnerabilities.description: A crafted SNMP packet triggers a stack overflow in the SNMP daemon of Cisco IOS/IOS XE. Authenticated attackers with low privileges can cause a denial‑of‑service condition, while attackers with high privileges can achieve root code execution. The vulnerability is present on any device with SNMP enabled.
products_versions: Cisco IOS/IOS XE (all versions with SNMP enabled)
Fortra GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.8.4 / 7.6.3 sustain release
Libraesva Email Security Gateway (versions prior to vendor patch)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the Cisco security advisory patch released for this CVE. If immediate patching is not possible, disable SNMP or restrict SNMP access to trusted management networks.
workarounds: Disable SNMP on devices that do not require it.
Implement ACLs to limit SNMP traffic to authorized management stations.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT,...
vulnerabilities.summary: Critical deserialization vulnerability in Fortra GoAnywhere MFT License Servlet allowing arbitrary command execution.
vulnerabilities.description: The License Servlet accepts a signed license response. An attacker who can forge a valid signature can supply a malicious serialized object, which is deserialized without integrity checks, leading to command injection on the server hosting GoAnywhere MFT.
products_versions: Cisco IOS/IOS XE (all versions with SNMP enabled)
Fortra GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.8.4 / 7.6.3 sustain release
Libraesva Email Security Gateway (versions prior to vendor patch)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade to GoAnywhere MFT version 7.8.4 (or sustain release 7.6.3) where the vulnerability is patched. Restrict public access to the admin console and enforce network segmentation.
workarounds: Place the admin console behind a VPN or firewall and allow access only from trusted IP ranges.
Validate license signatures using a separate verification service.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT,...
vulnerabilities.summary: Command injection in Libraesva Email Security Gateway triggered by specially crafted compressed email attachments.
vulnerabilities.description: Improper sanitization of code within compressed archive attachments allows an attacker to embed malicious commands. When the gateway processes the attachment, the commands are executed as a non‑privileged user, enabling further compromise of the email infrastructure.
products_versions: Cisco IOS/IOS XE (all versions with SNMP enabled)
Fortra GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.8.4 / 7.6.3 sustain release
Libraesva Email Security Gateway (versions prior to vendor patch)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the vendor‑released patch for the vulnerability. Until patched, block or quarantine compressed attachments from untrusted sources and enforce strict content‑filtering policies.
workarounds: Disable processing of compressed attachments.
Configure the gateway to extract archives in a sandboxed environment.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT,...
vulnerabilities.summary: Sudo misconfiguration allowing users to execute commands on unintended hosts when sudoers specifies a non‑current host.
vulnerabilities.description: When a sudoers entry references a host that is neither the current host nor ALL, sudo may incorrectly allow the listed user to run commands on other machines, potentially leading to lateral movement.
products_versions: Cisco IOS/IOS XE (all versions with SNMP enabled)
Fortra GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.8.4 / 7.6.3 sustain release
Libraesva Email Security Gateway (versions prior to vendor patch)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade sudo to version 1.9.17p1 or later. Review and correct sudoers entries to avoid specifying unrelated hosts.
workarounds: Audit sudoers files for host specifications and remove or correct them.

vulnerabilities.title: U.S. CISA adds Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT, Libraesva ESG, and Sudo flaws to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added Adminer, Cisco IOS, Fortra GoAnywhere MFT,...
vulnerabilities.summary: Local privilege escalation in Sudo due to loading /etc/nsswitch.conf from a user‑controlled directory when using the –chroot option.
vulnerabilities.description: When sudo is invoked with the –chroot option, it resolves /etc/nsswitch.conf using the current directory search path. An attacker can place a malicious nsswitch.conf in a directory they control, causing sudo to load it and ultimately gain root privileges.
products_versions: Cisco IOS/IOS XE (all versions with SNMP enabled)
Fortra GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.8.4 / 7.6.3 sustain release
Libraesva Email Security Gateway (versions prior to vendor patch)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade sudo to version 1.9.17p1 or later. Avoid using the –chroot option with untrusted paths.
workarounds: Restrict write access to directories that could be used as chroot locations.
Remove the –chroot option from sudo usage where not required.

vulnerabilities.title: Fortra GoAnywhere CVSS 10 Flaw Exploited as 0-Day a Week Before Public Disclosure
vulnerabilities.original_title: Fortra GoAnywhere CVSS 10 Flaw Exploited as 0-Day a Week Before Public Disclosure
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Cybersecurity company watchTowr Labs has disclosed that it has "credible evidence" of active exploitation of the recently disclosed security flaw in Fortra GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) software as early as September 10, 2025, a whole week before it was publicly disclosed. "This is not 'jus...
vulnerabilities.summary: Remote code execution vulnerability in Fortra GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server.
vulnerabilities.description: A critical flaw in GoAnywhere MFT (likely an input validation or deserialization issue) permits remote attackers to send crafted requests that trigger arbitrary code execution with system privileges. The vulnerability is exploitable over the network without authentication or user interaction. Active exploitation was observed as early as 2025-09-10, a week before public disclosure, indicating that threat actors have developed functional exploits.
products_versions: GoAnywhere MFT versions prior to the September 2025 security patch
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the vendor‑provided patch immediately. Upgrade to the latest patched version of GoAnywhere MFT. If a patch is not yet available, temporarily block inbound traffic to the MFT service, enforce strict firewall rules, and monitor for suspicious activity.
workarounds: Restrict network access to the GoAnywhere MFT service to trusted IP ranges.
Disable any unnecessary features or APIs that are not in use.
Enable multi‑factor authentication for administrative interfaces.

vulnerabilities.title: Fortra GoAnywhere CVSS 10 Flaw Exploited as 0-Day a Week Before Public Disclosure
vulnerabilities.original_title: Fortra GoAnywhere CVSS 10 Flaw Exploited as 0-Day a Week Before Public Disclosure
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Cybersecurity company watchTowr Labs has disclosed that it has "credible evidence" of active exploitation of the recently disclosed security flaw in Fortra GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) software as early as September 10, 2025, a whole week before it was publicly disclosed. "This is not 'jus...
vulnerabilities.summary: Remote code execution vulnerability in Fortra GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability resides in the GoAnywhere MFT web interface where input validation is insufficient, enabling an attacker to craft a malicious request that triggers arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges. Exploitation does not require authentication or user interaction and can be performed remotely over the network. Active exploitation was observed as early as 2025-09-10, a week before public disclosure.
products_versions: All GoAnywhere MFT versions prior to the vendor's security update (specific version numbers not disclosed in the article)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the vendor-supplied patch as soon as it becomes available. If a patch is not yet released, upgrade to the latest version that addresses the issue or temporarily disable the vulnerable component.
workarounds: Restrict external access to the GoAnywhere MFT web console using firewall rules or VPN.
Enforce IP allow‑lists to limit which hosts can reach the management interface.
Disable unused services and modules within GoAnywhere.
Monitor and block suspicious HTTP requests targeting the vulnerable endpoint.

vulnerabilities.title: Critical CVSS 10 Flaw in GoAnywhere File Transfer Threatens 20,000 Systems
vulnerabilities.original_title: Critical CVSS 10 Flaw in GoAnywhere File Transfer Threatens 20,000 Systems
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Urgent warning for Fortra GoAnywhere MFT users. A CVSS 10.0 deserialization vulnerability (CVE-2025-10035) in the License Servlet allows command injection. Patch to v7.8.4 immediately to prevent system takeover.
vulnerabilities.summary: Deserialization vulnerability in GoAnywhere MFT License Servlet allowing remote command injection.
vulnerabilities.description: An insecure deserialization flaw exists in the License Servlet of GoAnywhere MFT. An attacker can send a crafted serialized object to the servlet, which is deserialized without proper validation. This leads to arbitrary command execution on the underlying host, enabling full system takeover. The vulnerability is rated CVSS 10.0 due to its remote exploitability, lack of required privileges, and severe impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade GoAnywhere MFT to version 7.8.4 or later, which contains the fix for CVE-2025-10035. Apply the vendor-provided patch and restart the service.
workarounds: Restrict network access to the License Servlet (e.g., firewall or reverse proxy rules).
Disable the License Servlet if not required for operation.
Implement application-layer filtering to block suspicious serialized payloads.

vulnerabilities.title: Fortra Patches Critical GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.original_title: Fortra Patches Critical GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Tracked as CVE-2025-10035 (CVSS score of 10), the critical deserialization vulnerability could be exploited for command injection. The post Fortra Patches Critical GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.
vulnerabilities.summary: Critical deserialization vulnerability in Fortra GoAnywhere MFT that allows remote command injection.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability stems from insecure deserialization of untrusted data within GoAnywhere MFT. An attacker can craft malicious serialized objects that, when processed by the server, lead to arbitrary command execution on the underlying operating system. This enables full system compromise, data exfiltration, and service disruption.
products_versions: All pre‑patch versions of GoAnywhere MFT
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the patch released by Fortra for GoAnywhere MFT. Upgrade to the latest version that includes the fix. Verify the patch is successfully installed and restart the service.
workarounds: Restrict network access to the GoAnywhere MFT service to trusted IP ranges.
Disable or limit any functionality that processes serialized objects if not required.
Implement a web application firewall (WAF) rule to block suspicious payloads.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Patches Critical Entra ID Flaw Enabling Global Admin Impersonation Across Tenants
vulnerabilities.original_title: Microsoft Patches Critical Entra ID Flaw Enabling Global Admin Impersonation Across Tenants
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: A critical token validation failure in Microsoft Entra ID (previously Azure Active Directory) could have allowed attackers to impersonate any user, including Global Administrators, across any tenant. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-55241, has been assigned the maximum CVSS score of 10.0. It h...
vulnerabilities.summary: Token validation failure in Microsoft Entra ID allowing impersonation of any user, including Global Administrators, across tenants.
vulnerabilities.description: A flaw in the token validation logic of Microsoft Entra ID permits an attacker to craft or manipulate authentication tokens such that the service accepts them as valid for any user identity. Because the validation bypass is tenant‑agnostic, an attacker can impersonate privileged accounts (including Global Administrators) across any Azure AD tenant, leading to full control over tenant resources, data exfiltration, and lateral movement. The vulnerability stems from insufficient verification of token signatures and claims during the authentication flow.
affected_products: Microsoft 365 services that rely on Entra ID authentication
products_versions: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) – all cloud tenant versions prior to the June 2025 security update
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the security update released by Microsoft (June 2025 security baseline) that corrects the token validation logic. Verify that the latest version of Azure AD Connect and related services are installed. Enable Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps and Azure AD Identity Protection to monitor for anomalous token usage.
workarounds: Enforce Conditional Access policies that require MFA for all privileged sign‑ins.
Restrict issuance of long‑lived tokens and disable legacy authentication protocols.
Enable Privileged Identity Management (PIM) to require just‑in‑time elevation for admin roles.
Monitor and block token issuance from unknown locations using Azure AD sign‑in risk policies.

vulnerabilities.title: Fortra addressed a maximum severity flaw in GoAnywhere MFT software
vulnerabilities.original_title: Fortra addressed a maximum severity flaw in GoAnywhere MFT software
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Fortra addressed a critical flaw in GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) software that could result in the execution of arbitrary commands. Fortra addressed a critical vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-10035 (CVSS score of 10.0) in GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) software. Fortra GoAnywher...
vulnerabilities.summary: Deserialization vulnerability in the License Servlet of GoAnywhere MFT allowing remote command execution.
vulnerabilities.description: An attacker who can forge a valid license response signature can supply a crafted serialized object to the License Servlet. The servlet deserializes the object without proper validation, leading to arbitrary command execution on the underlying host. Exploitation requires the GoAnywhere admin console to be reachable from the Internet.
affected_products: Fortra GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) versions prior to 7.8.4
Fortra GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) versions prior to 7.6.3 (Sustain Release)
products_versions: GoAnywhere MFT versions prior to the December 2023 security patch for CVE-2024-0204
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade to GoAnywhere MFT version 7.8.4 or the Sustain Release 7.6.3 which contain the fix. Apply all security patches released by Fortra.
workarounds: Restrict public network access to the GoAnywhere Admin Console.
Place the admin console behind a VPN or restrict access to trusted IP ranges.

vulnerabilities.title: Fortra addressed a maximum severity flaw in GoAnywhere MFT software
vulnerabilities.original_title: Fortra addressed a maximum severity flaw in GoAnywhere MFT software
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Fortra addressed a critical flaw in GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) software that could result in the execution of arbitrary commands. Fortra addressed a critical vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-10035 (CVSS score of 10.0) in GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) software. Fortra GoAnywher...
vulnerabilities.summary: Authentication bypass via path traversal allowing creation of admin accounts in GoAnywhere MFT.
vulnerabilities.description: A path traversal vulnerability in the initial account setup endpoint (/InitialAccountSetup.xhtml) allows an unauthenticated attacker to reach the account creation routine. By exploiting this, the attacker can create new administrative users, effectively bypassing authentication controls.
affected_products: Fortra GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) versions prior to the patch released after December 2023
products_versions: GoAnywhere MFT versions prior to the December 2023 security patch for CVE-2024-0204
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the patch released by Fortra (details in the December 2023 advisory). Upgrade to the latest patched version of GoAnywhere MFT.
workarounds: Restrict external access to the GoAnywhere administration portal.
Monitor for unexpected admin account creation events.
references: Horizon3 Attack Team technical write‑up on CVE-2024-0204

vulnerabilities.title: Ding ding: Fortra rings the perfect-10 bell over latest GoAnywhere MFT bug
vulnerabilities.original_title: Ding ding: Fortra rings the perfect-10 bell over latest GoAnywhere MFT bug
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Outside experts say the vulnerability has probably already been exploited Budding ransomware crooks have another shot at exploiting Fortra's GoAnywhere MFT product now that a new 10/10 severity vulnerability needs patching.…
vulnerabilities.summary: Critical remote code execution vulnerability in Fortra GoAnywhere MFT allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability resides in the web interface of GoAnywhere MFT. An attacker can craft a specially formatted HTTP request that bypasses authentication and triggers execution of arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system. Successful exploitation results in full system compromise, enabling ransomware deployment and data exfiltration. Early reports indicate that threat actors have already begun exploiting the flaw in the wild.
products_versions: GoAnywhere MFT versions prior to the forthcoming 2025.2 patch
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the vendor-supplied security patch as soon as it becomes available. If a patch is not yet released, temporarily disable the vulnerable web service or restrict access to trusted IP ranges.
workarounds: Block inbound traffic to the GoAnywhere MFT web console from untrusted networks.
Enforce strict firewall rules limiting access to the management interface.
Enable multi-factor authentication for administrative accounts.

vulnerabilities.title: Fortra Releases Critical Patch for CVSS 10.0 GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.original_title: Fortra Releases Critical Patch for CVSS 10.0 GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Fortra has disclosed details of a critical security flaw in GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) software that could result in the execution of arbitrary commands. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-10035, carries a CVSS score of 10.0, indicating maximum severity. "A deserialization vulnerabil...
vulnerabilities.summary: Critical deserialization vulnerability in the License Servlet of GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer allowing remote code execution.
vulnerabilities.description: The License Servlet of GoAnywhere MFT improperly deserializes attacker‑controlled data. By sending a maliciously crafted serialized object to the servlet endpoint, an unauthenticated remote attacker can trigger arbitrary command execution on the underlying server. The flaw stems from insecure Java deserialization of objects without integrity checks, leading to full system compromise.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the critical patch released by Fortra immediately. Upgrade to the latest patched version of GoAnywhere MFT (version >= X.Y.Z). If patching cannot be performed immediately, disable the vulnerable License Servlet endpoint.
workarounds: Restrict network access to the License Servlet URL using firewall rules or network segmentation.
Deploy a Web Application Firewall (WAF) rule that blocks suspicious serialized payloads.
Validate and sanitize all input to the servlet if custom handling is implemented.

vulnerabilities.title: SAP Patches Critical NetWeaver (CVSS Up to 10.0) and Previously Exploited S/4HANA Flaws
vulnerabilities.original_title: SAP Patches Critical NetWeaver (CVSS Up to 10.0) and Previously Exploited S/4HANA Flaws
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: SAP on Tuesday released security updates to address multiple security flaws, including three critical vulnerabilities in SAP Netweaver that could result in code execution and the upload arbitrary files. The vulnerabilities are listed below - CVE-2025-42944 (CVSS score: 10.0) - A deserialization vuln...
vulnerabilities.summary: Unauthenticated remote deserialization vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver leading to remote code execution and arbitrary file upload.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability stems from insecure deserialization of untrusted data in SAP NetWeaver components. An attacker can send a crafted request containing malicious serialized objects, which are deserialized without proper validation. This leads to execution of arbitrary code on the server and the ability to upload files to arbitrary locations, potentially compromising the entire system.
products_versions: SAP NetWeaver (all supported versions as of 2025)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the SAP NetWeaver security patches released on 2025-09-10. Verify patch installation via SAP Note references. Ensure all NetWeaver instances are updated to the latest patch level.
workarounds: Restrict network access to NetWeaver services to trusted IP ranges.
Deploy a web application firewall (WAF) with rules to block suspicious serialized payloads.
Disable or limit the vulnerable service endpoints if they are not required.
references: SAP Security Note (specific note ID not provided in article)

vulnerabilities.summary: Additional critical vulnerabilities in SAP NetWeaver that could allow code execution and arbitrary file upload (details not disclosed).
vulnerabilities.description: The article references two other critical flaws in SAP NetWeaver that enable remote code execution and arbitrary file upload. Specific technical details and CVE identifiers were not provided.
products_versions: SAP NetWeaver (all supported versions as of 2025)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the SAP NetWeaver security updates released on 2025-09-10, which address all three critical issues.
workarounds: Network segmentation and access control for NetWeaver services.
Monitoring and blocking of anomalous traffic patterns.

vulnerabilities.summary: Unauthenticated deserialization vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver allowing remote code execution and arbitrary file upload.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability stems from insecure deserialization of untrusted data in SAP NetWeaver components. An attacker can craft a malicious serialized object and send it to the vulnerable endpoint without authentication. The vulnerable component deserializes the object, leading to execution of arbitrary code on the server and the ability to upload files to arbitrary locations, resulting in full system compromise.
products_versions: SAP NetWeaver (all supported versions as of 2025)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the SAP security patches released on 2025-09-10 that address CVE-2025-42944. Verify patch installation via SAP Note and restart affected services.
workarounds: Temporarily block inbound traffic to the vulnerable NetWeaver services at the network perimeter.
Disable or restrict the vulnerable deserialization functionality if possible via SAP configuration.

vulnerabilities.title: SAP September 2025 Patch Day fixed 4 critical flaws
vulnerabilities.original_title: SAP September 2025 Patch Day fixed 4 critical flaws
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: SAP issues 21 new and 4 updated security notes, fixing critical NetWeaver flaws enabling RCE and privilege escalation. SAP this week issued 21 new and four updated security notes as part of the company’s September Patch Day, including four notes that address critical vulnerabilities in NetWeav...
vulnerabilities.summary: Insecure deserialization in SAP NetWeaver AS Java RMI-P4 module allowing unauthenticated remote code execution.
vulnerabilities.description: An insecure deserialization flaw in the RMI-P4 component of SAP NetWeaver AS Java permits an unauthenticated attacker to send crafted serialized objects to the open P4 port. The malicious payload is deserialized without proper validation, leading to arbitrary OS command execution and full system compromise.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply SAP Security Note #3634501 released in the September 2025 Patch Day.
workarounds: Filter traffic to the P4 port at the ICM level to block unknown hosts.

vulnerabilities.title: SAP September 2025 Patch Day fixed 4 critical flaws

SAP this week issued 21 new and four updated security notes as part of the company’s September Patch Day, including four notes that address critical vulnerabilities in NetWeav...
vulnerabilities.summary: Insecure file operations in SAP NetWeaver AS Java allowing non‑admin users to upload and execute arbitrary files.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability stems from insufficient validation of file paths and upload mechanisms. Non‑administrative users can place malicious files in executable locations, which can then be executed by the application server, leading to full system compromise.
affected_products: SAP NetWeaver AS Java (file handling components)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply SAP Security Note #3643865 released in the September 2025 Patch Day.
workarounds: Restrict file upload directories to non‑executable locations.
Enforce strict file type validation and integrity checks.

vulnerabilities.summary: Directory traversal flaw in SAP NetWeaver AS ABAP allowing attackers to access arbitrary files on the server.
vulnerabilities.description: Improper validation of file path inputs enables an attacker to craft requests containing '../' sequences, bypassing access controls and retrieving files outside the intended directory tree, potentially exposing sensitive configuration and credential files.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the HotNews Note #3302162 update released in September 2025.
workarounds: Validate and canonicalize all file path inputs.
Deploy web‑application firewalls with rules to block path‑traversal patterns.

vulnerabilities.summary: Missing authentication check in SAP NetWeaver BC-OP-AS4 enabling unauthorized access to privileged functions.
vulnerabilities.description: A logic flaw omits an authentication verification step for certain backend operations. Attackers can directly invoke these operations without valid credentials, leading to privilege escalation and full system compromise.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the HotNews security note released in September 2025 that addresses this issue.
workarounds: Restrict network access to the affected service endpoints.
Implement additional application‑level access controls until the patch is applied.

vulnerabilities.title: Experts warn of actively exploited FreePBX zero-day
vulnerabilities.original_title: Experts warn of actively exploited FreePBX zero-day
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Sangoma warns of an actively exploited FreePBX zero-day affecting systems with publicly exposed admin control panels. The Sangoma FreePBX Security Team addressed an actively exploited FreePBX zero-day vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-57819 (CVSS score of 10.0), impacting systems with an internet-f...
vulnerabilities.summary: Insufficiently sanitized user-supplied data in FreePBX endpoint module allows unauthenticated access to FreePBX Administrator, leading to arbitrary database manipulation and remote code execution.
vulnerabilities.description: A validation/sanitization error in the processing of user-supplied input to the commercial 'endpoint' module in FreePBX allows unauthenticated attackers to access the FreePBX Administrator control panel. This vulnerability can be chained with other steps to gain potentially root level access on target systems.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Update to patched versions: FreePBX 15.0.66 or later, FreePBX 16.0.89 or later, FreePBX 17.0.3 or later.
workarounds: Restrict public access to the Administrator Control Panel (ACP)
Implement proper IP filtering/ACLs
Disconnect the ACP from direct public internet exposure
