vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft kills 9.9-rated ASP.NET Core bug – 'our highest ever' score
vulnerabilities.original_title: Microsoft kills 9.9-rated ASP.NET Core bug – 'our highest ever' score
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Flaw in Kestrel web server allowed request smuggling, impact depends on hosting setup and application code Microsoft has patched an ASP.NET Core vulnerability with a CVSS score of 9.9, which security program manager Barry Dorrans said was "our highest ever." The flaw is in the Kestrel web server com...
vulnerabilities.summary: Request smuggling vulnerability in ASP.NET Core Kestrel web server allowing security bypass
vulnerabilities.description: A flaw in the Kestrel HTTP server component of ASP.NET Core permits crafted HTTP requests to be interpreted differently by downstream components, resulting in request smuggling. Depending on the hosting configuration and application logic, an attacker can bypass authentication, perform cache poisoning, hijack sessions, or execute arbitrary code. The issue stems from improper parsing of HTTP/1.1 request line and header boundaries, allowing overlapping or ambiguous request boundaries.
products_versions: ASP.NET Core versions prior to the 2025-10-16 security update
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the Microsoft-provided security update for ASP.NET Core (Kestrel) released on 2025-10-16. Verify that the installed version includes the fix by checking the product version or security bulletin. Where immediate patching is not possible, disable Kestrel in favor of a hardened reverse proxy (e.g., IIS, Nginx, or Apache) that validates request boundaries.
workarounds: Configure a front‑end reverse proxy that normalizes HTTP requests before they reach Kestrel.
Enforce strict HTTP header validation in application code.
Limit exposure of Kestrel to internal networks only.

vulnerabilities.title: Urgent: Cisco ASA Zero-Day Duo Under Attack; CISA Triggers Emergency Mitigation Directive
vulnerabilities.original_title: Urgent: Cisco ASA Zero-Day Duo Under Attack; CISA Triggers Emergency Mitigation Directive
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Cisco is urging customers to patch two security flaws impacting the VPN web server of Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) Software, which it said have been exploited in the wild. The zero-day vulnerabilities in question are ...
vulnerabilities.summary: Improper validation of user-supplied input in the VPN web server of Cisco Secure Firewall ASA and FTD leads to remote code execution.
vulnerabilities.description: The VPN web server component fails to properly validate input supplied by remote users. An attacker can craft malicious HTTP requests that bypass input sanitization, leading to command injection and arbitrary code execution on the underlying ASA/FTD appliance. Successful exploitation provides full control of the firewall, allowing data exfiltration, configuration manipulation, and pivoting to internal networks.
affected_products: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software
Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) Software
products_versions: All ASA and FTD software versions prior to the September 2025 security patch
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the security patches released by Cisco for ASA and FTD immediately. Verify patch installation via the Cisco Security Advisory. If patching cannot be performed immediately, disable the VPN web server interface and restrict access to trusted management networks.
workarounds: Disable the ASA/FTD VPN web server (ASDM/ASDM Lite) until patches are applied.
Enforce strict ACLs to block inbound traffic to the web management interface from untrusted networks.
Enable multi-factor authentication for any administrative access to the firewall.
Monitor and block suspicious HTTP requests targeting the VPN portal.

vulnerabilities.title: Urgent: Cisco ASA Zero-Day Duo Under Attack; CISA Triggers Emergency Mitigation Directive
vulnerabilities.original_title: Urgent: Cisco ASA Zero-Day Duo Under Attack; CISA Triggers Emergency Mitigation Directive
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Cisco is urging customers to patch two security flaws impacting the VPN web server of Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) Software, which it said have been exploited in the wild. The zero-day vulnerabilities in question are ...
vulnerabilities.summary: Improper validation of user-supplied input in the VPN web server of Cisco Secure Firewall ASA and FTD allows remote code execution.
vulnerabilities.description: The VPN web server component fails to properly validate input supplied by remote attackers. An attacker can craft malicious HTTP requests that bypass validation checks, leading to arbitrary code execution on the underlying firewall appliance. Successful exploitation grants the attacker full control of the device, enabling data exfiltration, network pivoting, and disruption of security services.
affected_products: Cisco Secure Firewall Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software
Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense (FTD) Software
products_versions: Cisco ASA and FTD versions prior to the September 2025 security patch
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the security patches released by Cisco for the affected ASA and FTD versions. Update to the latest firmware that includes the fix for CVE-2025-20333. Verify patch installation via Cisco's advisory documentation.
workarounds: Temporarily disable the VPN web server interface if it is not required.
Restrict access to the VPN web server using ACLs or firewall rules to trusted IP ranges only.
Enable strong authentication and enforce TLS for all management traffic.

vulnerabilities.title: SAP S/4HANA Critical Vulnerability CVE-2025-42957 Exploited in the Wild
vulnerabilities.original_title: SAP S/4HANA Critical Vulnerability CVE-2025-42957 Exploited in the Wild
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: A critical security vulnerability impacting SAP S/4HANA, an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software, has come under active exploitation in the wild. The command injection vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-42957 (CVSS score: 9.9), was fixed by SAP as part of its monthly updates last month. "SAP ...
vulnerabilities.summary: Critical command injection vulnerability in SAP S/4HANA function module allowing remote code execution.
vulnerabilities.description: An attacker with standard user privileges can exploit a command injection flaw in a specific SAP S/4HANA function module. By supplying crafted input, the attacker can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the underlying server, leading to full system compromise. The vulnerability is exploitable over the network via SAP's standard interfaces and does not require additional user interaction.
products_versions: SAP S/4HANA (all versions prior to August 2025 security patch)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the SAP S/4HANA monthly security patch released in August 2025 which contains the fix for CVE-2025-42957. Verify patch installation via SAP Note and SAP Security Patch Manager.
workarounds: Restrict access to the vulnerable function module to trusted users only.
Implement network segmentation and firewall rules to limit external access to SAP S/4HANA services.
Deploy a Web Application Firewall (WAF) with rules to block suspicious command injection payloads.

vulnerabilities.title: China-Linked Salt Typhoon breaches European Telecom via Citrix exploit
vulnerabilities.original_title: China-Linked Salt Typhoon breaches European Telecom via Citrix exploit
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: China-linked Salt Typhoon hacked a European telecom in July 2025 via a Citrix NetScaler Gateway exploit for initial access. A European telecom firm was targeted in July 2025 by China-linked APT group Salt Typhoon (also known as Earth Estries, FamousSparrow, GhostEmperor, UNC5807, RedMike)), which ex...
vulnerabilities.summary: Citrix NetScaler Gateway remote code execution vulnerability exploited for initial access.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the Citrix NetScaler Gateway appliance by sending specially crafted HTTP requests that trigger a directory traversal and subsequent command injection. In the reported campaign, the attackers leveraged this flaw to gain a foothold inside a European telecom's network, later pivoting to Citrix Virtual Delivery Agent (VDA) hosts via a SoftEther VPN endpoint.
affected_products: Citrix NetScaler Gateway (ADC) versions prior to the December 2023 security patch
products_versions: Citrix NetScaler Gateway versions prior to 13.0-68.31 and 12.1-69.20 (pre‑patch releases).
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the Citrix security advisory patch released in December 2023 (or later). Upgrade to the latest supported NetScaler Gateway version. Verify that the appliance is running the patched firmware and that all default credentials have been changed.
workarounds: Restrict inbound traffic to the NetScaler Gateway to trusted IP ranges using firewall rules.
Disable any unused services and protocols on the appliance.
Enable multi-factor authentication for all VPN and gateway access.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft fixes highest-severity ASP.NET Core flaw ever
vulnerabilities.original_title: Microsoft fixes highest-severity ASP.NET Core flaw ever
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Earlier this week, Microsoft patched a vulnerability that was flagged with the "highest ever" severity rating received by an ASP.NET Core security flaw. [...]
vulnerabilities.summary: Remote code execution vulnerability in ASP.NET Core runtime allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable servers.
vulnerabilities.description: A flaw in the request handling component of ASP.NET Core enables specially crafted HTTP requests to bypass input validation and trigger unsafe deserialization. This leads to remote code execution with system-level privileges on the host. The vulnerability is present in all supported ASP.NET Core versions prior to the October 2025 security update. Exploitation does not require authentication or user interaction and can be performed over the network.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the security update released by Microsoft in the October 2025 Patch Tuesday (KB-XXXXX). Verify that the installed version is 6.0.23, 7.0.15, or later, which contain the fix.
workarounds: Temporarily block inbound traffic to the affected ASP.NET Core applications using a firewall or WAF.
Disable the vulnerable endpoint or feature if it is not required.
Enforce strict input validation and enable request size limits as a mitigation.

vulnerabilities.title: Gladinet Patches Exploited CentreStack Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.original_title: Gladinet Patches Exploited CentreStack Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: The unauthenticated local file inclusion bug allows attackers to retrieve the machine key and execute code remotely via a ViewState deserialization issue. The post Gladinet Patches Exploited CentreStack Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.
vulnerabilities.summary: Unauthenticated Local File Inclusion (LFI) in Gladinet CentreStack that enables retrieval of the machine key and remote code execution via ViewState deserialization.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability is an unauthenticated Local File Inclusion flaw in Gladinet CentreStack that allows an attacker to read arbitrary files on the server, specifically the machine key used for cryptographic operations. The attacker can then craft a malicious ViewState payload that, when deserialized by the application, leads to remote code execution. The chain requires no prior authentication, no user interaction, and can be triggered over the network.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the security patches released by Gladinet for CentreStack. Verify that the patch addresses both the LFI and the ViewState deserialization issue. Restart the application after patching.
workarounds: Disable ViewState MAC validation if not required (not recommended for production).
Restrict web server file system access to prevent arbitrary file reads.
Implement a web application firewall (WAF) rule to block requests containing suspicious LFI payloads (e.g., "../" sequences).

vulnerabilities.title: F5 Hack: Attack Linked to China, BIG-IP Flaws Patched, Governments Issue Alerts
vulnerabilities.original_title: F5 Hack: Attack Linked to China, BIG-IP Flaws Patched, Governments Issue Alerts
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: More information has come to light on the cyberattack disclosed this week by F5, including on attribution and potential risks. The post F5 Hack: Attack Linked to China, BIG-IP Flaws Patched, Governments Issue Alerts appeared first on SecurityWeek.
vulnerabilities.summary: Unauthenticated remote code execution in F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management Operating System (TMOS) via iControl REST API
vulnerabilities.description: A flaw in the iControl REST API allows an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary system commands on the BIG-IP appliance. The vulnerability is triggered by sending a crafted HTTP request to the management interface, leading to full system compromise.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the security patches released by F5 in the October 2025 advisory. Upgrade to BIG-IP TMOS version 16.1.4 or later, or 15.1.6 and above.
workarounds: Restrict access to the management interface using firewall rules or VPN.
Disable iControl REST API if not required.

vulnerabilities.title: F5 Hack: Attack Linked to China, BIG-IP Flaws Patched, Governments Issue Alerts
vulnerabilities.original_title: F5 Hack: Attack Linked to China, BIG-IP Flaws Patched, Governments Issue Alerts
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: More information has come to light on the cyberattack disclosed this week by F5, including on attribution and potential risks. The post F5 Hack: Attack Linked to China, BIG-IP Flaws Patched, Governments Issue Alerts appeared first on SecurityWeek.
vulnerabilities.summary: Unauthenticated remote code execution via BIG-IP Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI) self-test functionality
vulnerabilities.description: The TMUI self-test feature can be abused to execute arbitrary commands without authentication. An attacker can send a specially crafted request to the self-test endpoint, resulting in remote code execution.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Install the patches provided by F5 in the October 2025 security bulletin. Upgrade to BIG-IP TMOS version 16.1.4 or later, or 15.1.6+.
workarounds: Disable the TMUI self-test feature via the configuration utility.
Restrict access to the TMUI to trusted networks only.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday Oct 2025 Fixs 175 Vulnerabilities including 3 Zero-Days
vulnerabilities.original_title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday Oct 2025 Fixs 175 Vulnerabilities including 3 Zero-Days
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: October's Microsoft Patch Tuesday fixes 170+ flaws, including 3 actively exploited zero-days and critical WSUS RCE (CVSS 9.8). Immediate patching is mandatory. Final free updates for Windows 10.
vulnerabilities.summary: Critical remote code execution vulnerability in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM privileges.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability exists due to improper validation of client-supplied data in the WSUS management interface. An unauthenticated remote attacker can craft a specially crafted request that triggers a buffer overflow, leading to remote code execution with SYSTEM privileges on the WSUS server. Successful exploitation enables full control of the affected server and lateral movement within the network.
affected_products: Microsoft Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) 3.0 and later
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the Microsoft security update released on 2025-10-14 (KBxxxxx). After patching, restart the WSUS service. Verify the patch is installed via 'wmic qfe list' or Windows Update history.
workarounds: Temporarily block inbound traffic to WSUS ports (TCP 80, 443, 8530, 8531) from untrusted networks.
Disable remote management of WSUS if not required.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday Oct 2025 Fixs 175 Vulnerabilities including 3 Zero-Days
vulnerabilities.original_title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday Oct 2025 Fixs 175 Vulnerabilities including 3 Zero-Days
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: October's Microsoft Patch Tuesday fixes 170+ flaws, including 3 actively exploited zero-days and critical WSUS RCE (CVSS 9.8). Immediate patching is mandatory. Final free updates for Windows 10.
vulnerabilities.summary: Zero-day privilege escalation vulnerability in the Windows kernel allowing local users to gain SYSTEM privileges.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability stems from an unchecked pointer dereference in the kernel's handling of certain IOCTL calls. An attacker with a standard user account can invoke the vulnerable IOCTL to execute arbitrary code in kernel mode, resulting in SYSTEM-level privileges.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Install the cumulative update released on 2025-10-14 (KBxxxxx) which includes the fix for this kernel issue. Reboot the system after installation.
workarounds: Restrict execution of untrusted binaries via AppLocker or Windows Defender Application Control.
Enable Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) style mitigations where applicable.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday Oct 2025 Fixs 175 Vulnerabilities including 3 Zero-Days
vulnerabilities.original_title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday Oct 2025 Fixs 175 Vulnerabilities including 3 Zero-Days
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: October's Microsoft Patch Tuesday fixes 170+ flaws, including 3 actively exploited zero-days and critical WSUS RCE (CVSS 9.8). Immediate patching is mandatory. Final free updates for Windows 10.
vulnerabilities.summary: Zero-day remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft Office rendering engine that can be triggered via a malicious document.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability is caused by a memory corruption bug in the Office document parser. A specially crafted Office file can cause heap corruption leading to arbitrary code execution when the document is opened. Exploitation requires the victim to open or preview the malicious file.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the Office security update released on 2025-10-14 (KBxxxxx). Ensure automatic updates are enabled for Microsoft 365 applications.
workarounds: Disable the Office file preview feature in Windows Explorer and Outlook.
Configure Outlook to block potentially unsafe attachments.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday Oct 2025 Fixs 175 Vulnerabilities including 3 Zero-Days
vulnerabilities.original_title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday Oct 2025 Fixs 175 Vulnerabilities including 3 Zero-Days
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: October's Microsoft Patch Tuesday fixes 170+ flaws, including 3 actively exploited zero-days and critical WSUS RCE (CVSS 9.8). Immediate patching is mandatory. Final free updates for Windows 10.
vulnerabilities.summary: Zero-day elevation of privilege vulnerability in the Windows Print Spooler service (PrintNightmare variant) allowing remote attackers to install malicious drivers.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability resides in the Print Spooler service's handling of printer driver installation requests. An unauthenticated attacker can send a crafted RPC request that forces the spooler to load a malicious driver, resulting in SYSTEM-level code execution.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Install the cumulative update released on 2025-10-14 (KBxxxxx) which patches the Print Spooler handling. As a temporary mitigation, disable the Print Spooler service on machines where printing is not required.
workarounds: Set the Group Policy 'Restrict driver installation to approved drivers only'.
Disable remote printer enumeration via firewall rules.

vulnerabilities.title: Over 100 VS Code Extensions Exposed Developers to Hidden Supply Chain Risks
vulnerabilities.original_title: Over 100 VS Code Extensions Exposed Developers to Hidden Supply Chain Risks
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: New research has uncovered that publishers of over 100 Visual Studio Code (VS Code) extensions leaked access tokens that could be exploited by bad actors to update the extensions, posing a critical software supply chain risk. "A leaked VSCode Marketplace or Open VSX PAT [personal access token] allow...
vulnerabilities.summary: Leaked personal access tokens (PATs) for VS Code Marketplace or Open VSX allow attackers to publish malicious updates to over 100 compromised extensions, creating a critical supply chain risk.
vulnerabilities.description: Publishers of more than 100 VS Code extensions inadvertently exposed their Marketplace or Open VSX personal access tokens in publicly accessible repositories. An attacker who obtains such a token can authenticate to the extension registry as the legitimate publisher, upload malicious versions of the extensions, and have those updates automatically delivered to all users of the extensions. This enables a stealthy supply‑chain compromise affecting potentially millions of developers.
affected_products: Any VS Code extensions published by the compromised publishers
products_versions: All versions of VS Code extensions published by the compromised publishers
vulnerabilities.remediation: Revoke all compromised PATs immediately, generate new tokens with the principle of least privilege, and rotate any secrets stored in public repositories. Implement secret scanning in CI/CD pipelines, enforce signed extensions, and require two‑factor authentication for publisher accounts. Conduct a full audit of all extensions for unauthorized updates.
workarounds: Temporarily disable automatic updates for extensions from the affected publishers.
Manually verify extension signatures before installation.
Remove or replace compromised extensions with trusted alternatives.

vulnerabilities.title: Mysterious Elephant: a growing threat
vulnerabilities.original_title: Mysterious Elephant: a growing threat
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Introduction Mysterious Elephant is a highly active advanced persistent threat (APT) group that we at Kaspersky GReAT discovered in 2023. It has been consistently evolving and adapting its tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) to stay under the radar. With a primary focus on targeting governmen...
vulnerabilities.summary: Remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft Office Equation Editor allowing arbitrary code execution via crafted documents.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability resides in the Equation Editor component (EQNEDT32.EXE). An attacker can embed a maliciously crafted equation object in a Microsoft Office document. When the document is opened, the component loads the malicious object, leading to execution of arbitrary code in the context of the user. Mysterious Elephant leverages this flaw in its early attack chains to gain initial foothold before delivering its custom loaders.
products_versions: Microsoft Office versions prior to the 2017 security update
Google Chrome (any version with accessible user data directories)
exploit_kits: generic exploit kits referenced in campaign (unspecified)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply Microsoft security updates that address CVE-2017-11882. Disable the Equation Editor component via Group Policy or registry if not required. Use application whitelisting to block execution of EQNEDT32.EXE from untrusted sources.
workarounds: Disable Equation Editor via Office Trust Center settings.
Block execution of EQNEDT32.EXE using AppLocker or Windows Defender Application Control.

vulnerabilities.title: Harvard University hit in Oracle EBS cyberattack, 1.3 TB of data leaked by Cl0p group
vulnerabilities.original_title: Harvard University hit in Oracle EBS cyberattack, 1.3 TB of data leaked by Cl0p group
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Harvard University confirmed being targeted in the Oracle EBS campaign after the Cl0p ransomware group leaked 1.3 TB of data. Harvard University confirmed it was targeted in the Oracle E-Business Suite campaign after the Cl0p ransomware group listed it on its leak site. The cybercrime group claimed ...
vulnerabilities.summary: Unauthenticated remote code execution in Oracle E-Business Suite Concurrent Processing component
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability resides in the Oracle Concurrent Processing component of the E-Business Suite. An attacker can send a crafted HTTP request to the vulnerable endpoint without authentication, leading to remote code execution and full control over the Concurrent Processing service. Exploitation allows the attacker to execute arbitrary commands, install ransomware, and exfiltrate data from the compromised Oracle EBS environment. The flaw is easily exploitable over HTTP and was actively leveraged by the Cl0p ransomware group in a large‑scale data‑theft campaign targeting Harvard University and other organizations.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the emergency patch released by Oracle for CVE-2025-61882. Verify that the patch is installed on all EBS instances (12.2.3‑12.2.14). After patching, restart the Concurrent Processing services and perform a security scan to confirm remediation.
workarounds: Restrict inbound network traffic to the Oracle EBS web tier to trusted IP ranges only.
Deploy a Web Application Firewall (WAF) with rules to block suspicious HTTP requests to the Concurrent Processing endpoints.
Disable or limit the default password reset functionality until the patch is applied.
Enforce multi‑factor authentication for all privileged EBS accounts.
references: Oracle Security Alert for CVE-2025-61882 (emergency patch)
Google Threat Intelligence Group (GTIG) report on Oracle EBS campaign
Mandiant advisory on Cl0p activity against Oracle EBS
CrowdStrike analysis attributing exploitation to Cl0p

Harvard University confirmed it was targeted in the Oracle E-Business Suite campaign after the Cl0p ransomware group listed it on its leak site. The cybercrime group claimed ...
vulnerabilities.summary: Unauthenticated remote code execution in Oracle E-Business Suite Concurrent Processing component
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability resides in the Oracle Concurrent Processing component of Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS). An unauthenticated attacker can send specially crafted HTTP requests to the vulnerable endpoint, leading to remote code execution with full system privileges. The flaw is exploitable over the network without prior authentication and does not require user interaction. Successful exploitation allows attackers to take control of the EBS server, exfiltrate data, install ransomware, and move laterally within the environment.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the Oracle emergency patch released for CVE-2025-61882. Verify that the patch is installed on all EBS instances (12.2.3‑12.2.14). After patching, restart the Oracle services. Review and harden the Concurrent Processing configuration, disable unnecessary services, and enforce TLS for all HTTP traffic.
workarounds: Restrict network access to the Concurrent Processing HTTP endpoint using firewall rules or a Web Application Firewall (WAF).
Disable the default password reset functionality until the patch is applied.
Enforce strong, unique passwords for all EBS accounts and enable multi‑factor authentication (MFA).
references: Google Threat Intelligence Group report, Oct 2025
Mandiant blog post on Oracle EBS extortion campaign

vulnerabilities.summary: SQL injection zero‑day in MOVEit Transfer allowing unauthenticated data theft
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability is a SQL injection flaw in MOVEit Transfer that allows an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary SQL queries against the backend database, leading to data exfiltration and potential further compromise.
affected_products: MOVEit Transfer (various versions prior to vendor patch)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Upgrade to the latest MOVEit Transfer version that includes the vendor’s security fix. Apply any interim mitigations recommended by Progress Software.
workarounds: Block external access to the MOVEit Transfer web interface until patched.
Restrict database permissions for the MOVEit service account.

vulnerabilities.summary: Remote code execution vulnerability in GoAnywhere MFT
vulnerabilities.description: A flaw in GoAnywhere MFT allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands on the server without authentication, leading to full system compromise.
affected_products: GoAnywhere MFT (versions prior to vendor patch)

vulnerabilities.title: Oracle issued an emergency security update to fix new E-Business Suite flaw CVE-2025-61884
vulnerabilities.original_title: Oracle issued an emergency security update to fix new E-Business Suite flaw CVE-2025-61884
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Oracle issued an emergency security update to address a new E-Business Suite (EBS) vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-61884. Oracle released an emergency patch to address an information disclosure flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-61884 (CVSS Score of 7.5), in E-Business Suite’s Runtime UI component (version...
vulnerabilities.summary: Information disclosure vulnerability in Oracle E-Business Suite Runtime UI component allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to access sensitive resources.
vulnerabilities.description: The flaw resides in the Runtime UI component of Oracle E-Business Suite versions 12.2.3 through 12.2.14. An attacker can send crafted HTTP requests to the component without authentication, causing the server to disclose sensitive configuration or business data. The vulnerability does not require user interaction and can be exploited over the network.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the emergency out‑of‑band patch released by Oracle for CVE-2025-61884. Ensure the EBS instance is running a supported version and that all security patches are applied promptly.
workarounds: Restrict network access to the Runtime UI to trusted IP ranges.
Deploy a web application firewall (WAF) rule to block suspicious request patterns targeting the UI component.

Oracle released an emergency patch to address an information disclosure flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-61884 (CVSS Score of 7.5), in E-Business Suite’s Runtime UI component (version...
vulnerabilities.summary: Critical remote code execution vulnerability in Oracle E-Business Suite BI Publisher Integration that allows unauthenticated attackers to take control of the Oracle Concurrent Processing component.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability affects Oracle E-Business Suite versions 12.2.3 through 12.2.14. An unauthenticated attacker can send specially crafted HTTP requests to the BI Publisher Integration component, leading to remote code execution and full control of the Oracle Concurrent Processing subsystem. The flaw has been actively exploited by the Cl0p ransomware group for data theft and extortion campaigns.
affected_products: Oracle E-Business Suite BI Publisher Integration
vulnerabilities.remediation: Install the emergency patch released by Oracle for CVE-2025-61882 immediately. Verify that the patch is applied on all EBS instances and that the system is running a supported release.
workarounds: Block external access to the BI Publisher Integration endpoints using firewall rules.
Enforce strict authentication and MFA for any administrative interfaces.
Monitor and limit HTTP traffic to the affected servlet paths.
references: Mandiant report on Cl0p exploitation of Oracle EBS

vulnerabilities.title: Google, Mandiant expose malware and zero-day behind Oracle EBS extortion
vulnerabilities.original_title: Google, Mandiant expose malware and zero-day behind Oracle EBS extortion
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Google and Mandiant link Oracle EBS extortion emails to known July-patched flaws and a likely zero-day, CVE-2025-61882. Google Threat Intelligence and Mandiant analyzed the Oracle E-Business Suite extortion campaign, revealing the use of malware. Attackers exploited July-patched EBS flaws and likely...
vulnerabilities.summary: Unauthenticated remote code execution in Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) Concurrent Processing component via crafted HTTP requests to SyncServlet and malicious XSLT template upload.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability resides in the Oracle Concurrent Processing component of E-Business Suite. An unauthenticated attacker can send an HTTP POST request to /OA_HTML/SyncServlet to bypass authentication, then upload a malicious XSLT template via the XML Publisher Template Manager (using endpoints such as /OA_HTML/RF.jsp and /OA_HTML/OA.jsp). The malicious template is executed during preview, allowing arbitrary command execution. Attackers typically deploy a Java downloader (GOLDVEIN.JAVA) that contacts a C2 server over a disguised TLSv3.1 handshake, followed by a multi‑stage SAGE payload chain (SAGEGIFT → SAGELEAF → SAGEWAVE) that installs an in‑memory web shell behind /OA_HTML/help/... . The web shell enables persistent remote command execution, data exfiltration, and lateral movement. Post‑exploitation activity includes reconnaissance commands (ifconfig, netstat, ps, cat /etc/fstab) and reverse shells (bash -i) to attacker‑controlled IPs.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply Oracle's emergency patch for CVE-2025-61882 immediately. Restrict external network access to Oracle EBS instances (e.g., firewall rules, VPN only). Disable or restrict the default password reset functionality. Enforce strong authentication and MFA for all EBS accounts. Rotate all credentials that may have been compromised. Deploy a Web Application Firewall (WAF) with signatures for the vulnerable servlet paths.
workarounds: Block inbound traffic to /OA_HTML/SyncServlet, /OA_HTML/RF.jsp, /OA_HTML/OA.jsp, and /OA_HTML/help/ paths from untrusted networks.
Disable XML Publisher Template Manager if not required.
Enforce least‑privilege for the applmgr account and disable its ability to upload XSLT templates.
Monitor and restrict outbound TLS connections from EBS servers to unknown destinations.
references: Mandiant report on Oracle EBS extortion campaign

vulnerabilities.description: An unauthenticated attacker can exploit a SQL injection flaw in the MOVEit Transfer web interface to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system. The vulnerability is leveraged by Clop ransomware to exfiltrate data and deploy ransomware payloads.
products_versions: MOVEit Transfer versions prior to the May 2023 patch
Accellion FTA versions prior to the undisclosed security update
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the vendor-supplied patch released by Progress Software. Disable public access to the MOVEit web interface where possible and enforce strong authentication.
workarounds: Restrict inbound traffic to the MOVEit server to trusted IP ranges.
Implement a Web Application Firewall (WAF) rule to block the malicious SQL payloads.

Accellion FTA versions prior to the undisclosed security update

workarounds: Block external access to the GoAnywhere MFT management interface.

products_versions: MOVEit Transfer versions prior to the May 2023 patch
Accellion FTA versions prior to the undisclosed security update

workarounds: Place the Accellion FTA behind a VPN and enforce multi‑factor authentication for all administrative access.
Disable unused services and enforce least‑privilege network segmentation.

vulnerabilities.summary: Remote code execution vulnerability in GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server.
vulnerabilities.description: The vulnerability resides in the file handling component of GoAnywhere MFT. An attacker can send a specially crafted request that triggers unsafe deserialization/command injection, leading to execution of arbitrary commands with the privileges of the GoAnywhere service. Successful exploitation provides full control over the affected server, enabling data theft, ransomware deployment, or lateral movement within the network.
products_versions: GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer versions prior to 2025.1.0
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the vendor-supplied patch released by HelpSystems. Upgrade to the latest patched version of GoAnywhere MFT (version 2025.1.0 or later). Verify that the patch is correctly installed and restart the service.
workarounds: Restrict inbound network access to the MFT service to trusted IP ranges.
Disable any unnecessary remote management interfaces.
Implement network segmentation to isolate the MFT server from critical assets.

vulnerabilities.original_title: DDoS Botnet Aisuru Blankets US ISPs in Record DDoS
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: The world’s largest and most disruptive botnet is now drawing a majority of its firepower from compromised Internet-of-Things (IoT) devices hosted on U.S. Internet providers like AT&T, Comcast and Verizon, new evidence suggests. Experts say the heavy concentration of infected devices at U....
vulnerabilities.summary: Mirai botnet exploits default/weak credentials on IoT devices via Telnet
vulnerabilities.description: The Mirai source code, which forms the basis of the Aisuru botnet, includes modules that scan the Internet for devices exposing Telnet with default or weak credentials. Successful login allows the bot to download and execute malicious payloads, enrolling the device into a large-scale DDoS botnet.
affected_products: Other IoT devices with Telnet access
products_versions: Totolink router firmware prior to April 2025
IoT devices with default Telnet credentials (any version)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Change default passwords on all IoT devices, disable Telnet where possible, apply vendor firmware updates, and segment IoT devices on separate VLANs.
workarounds: Block inbound/outbound Telnet (port 23) at the network perimeter
Implement network access control (NAC) to restrict device onboarding

vulnerabilities.summary: Compromise of Totolink router firmware update server to distribute malicious scripts
vulnerabilities.description: XLab reported that the Aisuru operators compromised the firmware distribution website of Totolink in April 2025. By injecting malicious scripts into the update process, they were able to deliver a backdoor payload to any device that fetched updates, rapidly expanding the botnet.
affected_products: Totolink low-cost routers and networking gear
products_versions: Totolink router firmware prior to April 2025
IoT devices with default Telnet credentials (any version)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Totolink must revoke compromised signing keys, issue signed firmware updates, and notify customers to reinstall clean firmware. End users should reflash devices with verified firmware from trusted sources.
workarounds: Disable automatic firmware updates until a trusted update is released
Place routers behind firewalls that restrict outbound connections to unknown servers

Disable the vulnerable web management interface if not needed.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2025-5947: WordPress Plugin flaw lets hackers access Admin accounts
vulnerabilities.original_title: CVE-2025-5947: WordPress Plugin flaw lets hackers access Admin accounts
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Threat actors are exploiting a critical flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-5947, in the Service Finder WordPress theme’s Bookings plugin. Threat actors are exploiting a critical vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-5947 (CVSS score 9.8), in the Service Finder WordPress theme’s Bookings plugin. The plugin (vers...
vulnerabilities.summary: Authentication bypass in Service Finder WordPress theme's Bookings plugin allowing unauthenticated attackers to log in as any user, including administrators.
vulnerabilities.description: The service_finder_switch_back() function in the Bookings plugin does not properly validate the original_user_id cookie. An attacker can craft a malicious cookie value and send a request containing the 'switch_back' parameter, causing WordPress to authenticate the attacker as any chosen user account, including administrators. This results in full site compromise and enables further malicious activities such as installing backdoors or defacing the site.
affected_products: Service Finder WordPress theme – Bookings plugin
vulnerabilities.remediation: Update the Service Finder Bookings plugin to a version newer than 6.0 (patched version released on 2025-07-17). Ensure the plugin is obtained from the official source and verify the integrity of the update.
workarounds: Temporarily deactivate the Bookings plugin until the patched version is applied.
Block requests containing the 'switch_back' parameter at the web server or WAF level.
Enforce strict cookie validation and set the HttpOnly and Secure flags for authentication cookies.

vulnerabilities.title: Critical Exploit Lets Hackers Bypass Authentication in WordPress Service Finder Theme
vulnerabilities.original_title: Critical Exploit Lets Hackers Bypass Authentication in WordPress Service Finder Theme
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Threat actors are actively exploiting a critical security flaw impacting the Service Finder WordPress theme that makes it possible to gain unauthorized access to any account, including administrators, and take control of susceptible sites. The authentication bypass vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025...
vulnerabilities.summary: Authentication bypass in Service Finder WordPress theme/plugin allowing unauthenticated attackers to gain admin access.
vulnerabilities.description: The Service Finder Bookings component bundled with the Service Finder WordPress theme contains a flaw that bypasses the authentication routine. By sending a crafted request to the vulnerable endpoint, an attacker can obtain a valid session token for any user, including the site administrator, without providing credentials. This enables full control over the WordPress installation, allowing malicious actions such as defacement, data theft, and installation of additional backdoors.
products_versions: All versions prior to the security patch released in September 2025
vulnerabilities.remediation: Update to the latest version of the Service Finder theme/plugin that includes the authentication bypass fix. If an update is not yet available, temporarily deactivate or uninstall the Service Finder Bookings plugin and apply a Web Application Firewall rule to block the vulnerable endpoint.
workarounds: Deactivate the Service Finder Bookings plugin until a patched version is released.
Restrict access to the vulnerable endpoint using .htaccess or a WAF.
Enforce two-factor authentication for all admin accounts.

vulnerabilities.title: Oracle EBS Under Fire as Cl0p Exploits CVE-2025-61882 in Real-World Attacks
vulnerabilities.original_title: Oracle EBS Under Fire as Cl0p Exploits CVE-2025-61882 in Real-World Attacks
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: CrowdStrike on Monday said it's attributing the exploitation of a recently disclosed security flaw in Oracle E-Business Suite with moderate confidence to a threat actor it tracks as Graceful Spider (aka Cl0p), and that the first known exploitation occurred on August 9, 2025. The malicious activity i...
vulnerabilities.summary: Critical remote code execution vulnerability in Oracle E-Business Suite
vulnerabilities.description: CVE-2025-61882 is a critical vulnerability in Oracle E-Business Suite that allows unauthenticated remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on the underlying server. The flaw resides in the web component that processes specially crafted HTTP requests, leading to deserialization of untrusted data and subsequent command execution. Successful exploitation grants the attacker full control over the affected system, enabling data theft, lateral movement, and persistence.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the official Oracle security patch for CVE-2025-61882 as soon as it becomes available. If a patch is not yet released, mitigate by disabling the vulnerable web component, restricting network access to the EBS application servers, and enforcing strict input validation on all public-facing endpoints.
workarounds: Restrict inbound traffic to Oracle EBS servers to trusted IP ranges using firewall rules.
Disable or block the vulnerable endpoint until a patch is applied.
Enable Web Application Firewall (WAF) rules to detect and block malicious payloads targeting the vulnerable component.

vulnerabilities.title: Oracle Rushes Patch for CVE-2025-61882 After Cl0p Exploited It in Data Theft Attacks
vulnerabilities.original_title: Oracle Rushes Patch for CVE-2025-61882 After Cl0p Exploited It in Data Theft Attacks
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Oracle has released an emergency update to address a critical security flaw in its E-Business Suite software that it said has been exploited in the recent wave of Cl0p data theft attacks. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-61882 (CVSS score: 9.8), concerns an unspecified bug that could allow an ...
vulnerabilities.summary: Unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability in Oracle E-Business Suite allowing attackers to take control via HTTP.
vulnerabilities.description: A critical flaw in Oracle E-Business Suite (specific component undisclosed) permits an unauthenticated attacker with network access over HTTP to execute arbitrary code and gain full control of the affected system. The vulnerability is exploitable without prior credentials or user interaction and has been actively used by the Cl0p ransomware group in data theft campaigns.
products_versions: Oracle E-Business Suite (all versions prior to the emergency patch)
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the emergency patch released by Oracle for CVE-2025-61882. Verify patch installation and restart affected services.
workarounds: Restrict inbound HTTP traffic to the E-Business Suite servers using firewall rules or a web application firewall.
Disable unnecessary HTTP endpoints until the patch is applied.
Enforce network segmentation to limit exposure of the E-Business Suite to untrusted networks.

vulnerabilities.title: Clop crew hits Oracle E-Business Suite users with fresh zero-day
vulnerabilities.original_title: Clop crew hits Oracle E-Business Suite users with fresh zero-day
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Big Red rushes out patch for 9.8-rated flaw after crooks exploit it for data theft and extortion Oracle rushed out an emergency fix over the weekend for a zero-day vulnerability in its E-Business Suite (EBS) that criminal crew Clop has already abused for data theft and extortion.…
vulnerabilities.summary: Zero-day remote code execution vulnerability in Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) exploited by the Clop ransomware group for data theft and extortion.
vulnerabilities.description: A previously unknown vulnerability in Oracle E-Business Suite allows unauthenticated remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on the underlying operating system. The flaw resides in the web component that processes specially crafted HTTP requests, leading to deserialization of untrusted data. Successful exploitation grants the attacker full control of the EBS server, enabling data exfiltration, database manipulation, and deployment of ransomware payloads. The vulnerability was actively exploited by the Clop criminal group shortly after discovery, resulting in large‑scale data theft and extortion campaigns against multiple organizations.
products_versions: All Oracle E-Business Suite versions prior to the emergency patch released on 2025-10-06
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the emergency patch released by Oracle on 2025-10-06. Verify patch installation via Oracle Support tools and restart affected services.
workarounds: Restrict inbound network traffic to the EBS web tier to trusted IP ranges only.
Disable the vulnerable web component or module if it is not required for business operations.
Enforce multi‑factor authentication for all privileged EBS accounts.

vulnerabilities.original_title: Detecting DLL hijacking with machine learning: real-world cases
vulnerabilities.content_snippet: Introduction Our colleagues from the AI expertise center recently developed a machine-learning model that detects DLL-hijacking attacks. We then integrated this model into the Kaspersky Unified Monitoring and Analysis Platform SIEM system. In a separate article, our colleagues shared how the model h...
vulnerabilities.summary: Remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint when hosted on IIS, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted requests.
vulnerabilities.description: An attacker can send a specially crafted request to the SharePoint web service hosted by IIS, causing the w3wp.exe process to load a malicious DLL (webengine4.dll) and subsequently execute arbitrary code. In the observed incident, the attacker leveraged this flaw to drop a malicious SystemSettings.dll alongside SystemSettings.exe, which was later used for DLL sideloading (T1574.001) to establish persistence and run a Cobalt Strike payload.
affected_products: Microsoft SharePoint Server (on-premises) running on IIS
vulnerabilities.remediation: Apply the Microsoft security update released for CVE-2021-27076. Ensure SharePoint and IIS are fully patched, disable unnecessary web services, and enforce least‑privilege execution for application pools.
workarounds: Restrict inbound traffic to SharePoint servers to trusted networks.
Enable DLL signature verification and enforce safe DLL search order (e.g., SetDllDirectory).
Monitor and block unexpected DLL loads from non‑system directories.
